author: Annii
title: Bright and playful.
review:
Bright and playful.

Pros

  • Wonderful bright colours.
  • The figures are very well made.  Flounder has such a happy face - my daughter (15mths)shreaks with laughter when she finds him.
  • The set has a good number of pieces allowing for 'free play'.
  • This is a good set to start younger children on as the large turrets and accessories add interest.

Cons

  • The swing is a bit 'fidly' as it does not firmly clip into place and falls out of the cradle when moved around.
  • The treasure chest is a nice idea, but it lacks authenticity.  It is made of a strange 'gold' plactic that makes the chest appear more like a cheap lucky packet toy.  The design of a proper hinged lid would have been more in keeping with the high standard of quality we have come to expect from Duplo/Lego.

A lovley set - truely.  It is definelty my favourite of the Duplo Disney Princess Range.  Expensive, yes...hense my expectation of well designed components, all but the treasure chest.  The children love it.

author: Legolauncher
title: Unique set
review: I really like the unique underwater pieces in this set. Great to repurpose for castles!
